placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Log Restaurant in Saigon is a popular choice for food enthusiasts seeking a unique dining experience. Located on the rooftop of GEM Center, it offers an open-air space designed to resemble a treehouse, creating a serene atmosphere surrounded by greenery. The restaurant's modern fusion cuisine is crafted with passion and creativity, presented as culinary works of art. Inspired by fairy tale wooden houses, the interior exudes coziness and tranquility with warm lighting and the scent of Meranti wood.

reviews.reviewText:
I came here for dinner with my parents to celebrate their wedding anniversary, and we greatly enjoyed our time here! The restaurant opens at 6PM, and we arrived a little after 6PM, so it was very empty, but around 7PM, it was pretty busy! We visited on a Monday for the Mega Monday deal ‚ò∫Ô∏è
The food was great; We wanted to try many dishes, and my mother greatly enjoyed the lobster in truffle cream sauce. We went to order the lobster, but we do not speak Vietnamese, and the chef does not seem to speak English. However, a server in black suit quickly rushed to us and helped us order in fluent English. We greatly appreciated her help! This is not our first time here, and all the servers here are very professional and helpful üåü
I highly recommend getting the grilled lobster in spicy cheese or grilled scallop in spicy cheese üåüüåü
The dessert section was also great! I liked the peanut butter chocolate mousse ‚ò∫Ô∏è
The interior design is also quite beautiful üåü

Since I visit for hosting a private business dinner for group of 20 persons++ of Thai entrepreneurs so I reserved a room with provided projectors.

The staffs are more than happy to help and assisting and supports during the dine. The food are really nice which matched our requirements in having a special meal before getting back to Thailand.

Also, the decorations were really nice both the venue and food styling.

Will visit again for my private dinner.

Good vibe, good decoration, however the quality of food is not consistent. I have visited here two times and the second time the quality and freshness of food are better.

Their lobsters, seafood and sashimi are not always fresh. I really enjoyed salmon on my recently visit. Beef steak is very good.

Their desserts are good too. Not so sweet.

Overall, it is worth to try once for a while.

Outstanding Dining at The Log

Elegant ambiance, excellent service, and outstanding seafood. A must-visit for fine dining lovers!

Best buffet I ever had. Plenty of fresh seafood and meat to choose from. I personally ate a lot of lobster and clams. You can have unlimited wine for a few bucks while enjoying the beautiful interior. The staff is friendly and very quick.

Beside the good interior and decor, the place is totally not worth its reputation. The service staff is not well trained, with somewhat I-don't-care attitude. The food is okay for its price but it definitely just an oversell for someone who has not had western food. Over, I do not recommend this place. AT ALL.

Fresh seafood with variety of selections. However, the taste of all food was a bit too sweet. A bit dissapointed with the taste ( not sure if it's to suit the local taste since we had a better taste of Vietnamese dishes throughout our trip).

Not recomended for those who don't like sweet taste in food. ( the fish were sweet, sauces were also sweet, and even mashed potatoes were sweet)

I gave 4 stars because of freshness of food, variety, service and ambience.

The place is supper to be honest. I went here during weekend - christmas time and the decorations are simple but gorgeous. Foods is definitely delicious and of course the price is at normal high standard. We dined in for a group of 10 and the total bill is just 11mil (with lobster and imported wine). Must try place for sure, dude!

reviews.reviewText:
the breakfast is nice.
the servers are quite attentive.

2023/03/19 had the seafood buffet for dinner.
service team was nice.
however, the seafood could be better. from what I remember, many hotel has the same function. but Mezz has a higher fee. If that is the case, I would hope the seafood variety and freshness is almost like live catch standard.  Also, although it is seafood buffet, but the roast beef was slightly too dry.

Lunch buffet: East Asian & Western cuisine - Nothing too memorable except for the Cantonese dishes

For a buffet ticket you get a free flow of tea and coffee juice bar is quite limited too.

The Mezz's "Interactive Lunch Buffet" from 12:00 ‚Äì 14:30, Monday ‚Äì Friday, serves popular cuisine (Japanese, Cantonese, Vietnamese, Western (idk salad bar, with very limited cheese and Charcuterie meat options, a pasta bar, pizza, and lots of dessert)

I love how it gets packed during a normal Thursday lunch, but the food gets refilled very quickly. I enjoyed their salad bar with a good variety of dressings, and high-quality cheese, but nothing beat their Cantonese menu with all the popular dishes you can find. The Cantonese line was the first to run out when I was there so the people agreed with me. Other line of food was ok, not too wow or fab.

The server and the overall atmosphere were nice to me, but for a 5-star hotel, the space feels lil bit tight, tables were pretty close to each other.

I think for the same price and luxurious experience, but better quality food, you can find other places in the same area.

Mezz is the main restaurant inside the Sofitel Saigon Plaza and where the breakfast is served and more. This place has a great ambience, vibe and fitout that doesn't feel like a regular hotel venue. It feels a cross between the local market, food hall and buffet stand with a beautiful relaxed space. The staff here are super friendly, helpful and attentive. The food on offer is fresh and has a large variety and diversity to local food and western. Definitely recommend a visit, you won't leave hungry or disappointed

Restaurant is cramped, dark.  Flavor was odd, fish overcooked, appetizer strange taste, desert strange, service was ok but the two waitress both had very poor English skills; worse English than any other restaurant out of 11 days in Vietnam and this is a western Hotel location in central Ho Chi Minh district 1

Food variety was good. Flavors were ok. Some of the dishes were not well cooked. Turkey was dry. Clams were not fresh. Rice was off. Food servers were not well trained. They had trouble Cutting and serving the meats properly. My biggest was the noise level. The staff had decorated all the tables with blow whistles and clackers to celebrate Christmas. We were sat next to a family of 3 small children. The children kept running around the tables yelling and blowing the whistles and clackers. It felt like a kid‚Äôs birthday party at Chuck E Cheese not a 5 star buffet. It totally ruined the meal for me.
Delicious foods. I love sushi bar here. Fresh fish. Grilled pork - beef - lambs not so good.

Pastry is very nice, Dimsum not good so hard, not yummy as other places
Staff is friendly
The service was top notch especially from That Man Lan. Appreciate her pro-active service and friendliness.

reviews.reviewText:
A lot of kinds of food. All of them seem to be good quality.The flavor is okay.
This place is "all you can eat" restaurant with reasonable price.
They have BBQ and hotpot also. But I often feel so full before I can order hotpot.
When it is crowded, you have to wait a few minute to get order. Sometimes, the staff is a bit slow.
Overall, everything is good here is you want to have a full stomach before come back home.

This is the first time I've ever experienced the bad feeling when I was having a BUFFET dinner. I went there and waited for 5 minutes just for having menu. Since my friends come a bit late I ordered Pepsi to drink and some dishes first. However I had been waiting for 15 mins just for a can of Pepsi. After few times friendly remind about food they brought me 3 dishes of beef and then again another waiting. I know that's they are a bit busy because lots of people come to eat as year end parties but I wait for so long and my grill mat isn't good enough so my food is stuck with some coal dust. Therefore I had to repeat myself several times to get it changed. When I come to a BUFFET restaurant I expect that food is served quickly and plentifuly because I pay a lot to eat freely and comfortably. I would never come back to this place.

i had set lunch here several times. Food are nice. but the Udon noodle is not impressive much. The space is convenient but noisy. it is a place mainly for BBQ at night. the light is warm and dim, good for lunch, nice for group casual dinner, but not suggest this place for private dinner.
Lunch set is value for money, but the taste of fried pork is really below average
Good service, fresh meat. There is a limit of 5 oysters per buffet customer.
Very nice and caring Service and the food was quite delicious. Prices are very fair and reasonable.

The price is cheap, the taste is good and the atmosphere is good.
It's good to go with your lover.
A fusion of Korean and Japanese food... Lots of choices... And good price... Highly recommend :)

placeMetadata.description: Refined hotel with 2 restaurants, a lobby bar & an outdoor pool, plus a gym & a spa.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Hotel Nikko Saigon is a luxurious 5-star hotel offering 388 well-appointed rooms, suites, and apartments. It features two restaurants, a lobby bar, an outdoor pool, a gym, and a spa with treatment rooms. The hotel boasts the second largest ballroom in Ho Chi Minh City and seven meeting rooms. Guests can enjoy the Nikko Club Lounge on the 23rd floor with spectacular city views.

reviews.reviewText:
I shall continue to come back to this hotel every time I am in Saigon because they provided extra care during our stay and ensured a smooth process!

From the first tea to morning breakfast to allowing us to keep our luggage upon our trip‚Äôs return, Hotel Nikko is the best place to stay in Saigon.

Raymond was excellent bell man during our stay and deserves all the praise! He ensured all of our numerous luggage was safe. No request was too large. I hope to meet him again during my next visit.

I had wine at the lobby lounge, the waiters are polite and good smile, make me had my second glass of wine, love itüòÅ.

Breakfast, i didn't take photo. But is variety choices. I like it so muchüòãüòã. Oh ya, can have a walk at their garden after breakfast.

Maybe it is quiet old hotel? But the bed is no sink as what i expert. Definitely will want to stay again.

Beside had a shopping mall, able to look for food, however is not much. Take grab to Takashimaya shopping mall, is ok for me.

Luc, Nam, and Thai gave us great services! They are always very attentive and give us additional napkins! They come to fill our drinks and take away the used plates often. They provide excellent customer services. Thank you so much for your services, all! We had a great experiences here! üòÉ

Very nice stay at Nikko Saigon Hotel. Rooms are spacious and clean. Nice gym and pool area and everything worked out perfectly. Breakfast has had a lot of variety and fresh coconuts were a highlight! We had shuttle service to take us to a different location every day.

Very attentive and great service. The staff was there to help us with everything, even planning and booking our next trip to Nha Trang. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Nikko Saigon in Ho Chi Minh City, and I must say it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. This five-star property truly lives up to its reputation for relaxation and refined Japanese hospitality.

From the moment I arrived, I was greeted by the warm and professional staff at the front desk. Tracy, in particular, went above and beyond to ensure my check-in process was smooth and personalized. She took the time to explain all the hotel amenities and even offered recommendations for local attractions. Her attention to detail and genuine smile made me feel instantly welcome.

The room was absolutely stunning - spacious, modern, and impeccably clean with a minimalist design that created a sense of tranquility. The marble bathroom with its separate soaking tub and walk-in shower was luxurious, and I appreciated thoughtful touches like the electronic Toto toilet system and high-quality toiletries. The 42-inch flat-screen TV, complimentary high-speed Wi-Fi, and comfortable workstation made it perfect for both relaxation and business needs.

One of the highlights of my stay was dining at La Brasserie. The restaurant staff there deserves special recognition for their exceptional service. They were knowledgeable about every dish, attentive without being intrusive, and always ready with thoughtful recommendations. The international buffet breakfast was simply outstanding - possibly the widest selection I've ever seen at a hotel. Their seafood dinner buffet was equally impressive, featuring unlimited lobsters, crabs, and oysters that were fresh and delicious.

I also had the opportunity to visit the 5 Senses restaurant on the ground floor, which offers modern Japanese cuisine with creative flair. The presentation of each dish was like a work of art, and the flavors were extraordinary. Again, the staff's expertise and friendly demeanor enhanced the dining experience.

The hotel's facilities are top-notch. The outdoor pool provided a peaceful retreat after a day of exploring the city. The fitness center was well-equipped with modern machines, and the spa services were rejuvenating. I particularly enjoyed spending time in the Nikko Club Lounge on the 23rd floor, which offers spectacular views of the city along with complimentary refreshments throughout the day.

While the hotel is located slightly away from the main tourist areas, this actually became an advantage as it provided a peaceful sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The complimentary shuttle service to major attractions made it convenient to explore Ho Chi Minh City.

What truly sets Hotel Nikko Saigon apart is its staff. From the concierge team who helped arrange tours and transportation, to the housekeeping staff who maintained the room to perfection, to the attentive servers at all dining venues - everyone demonstrated the highest level of professionalism and genuine care for guests.

Hotel Nikko Saigon has definitely become my go-to accommodation in Ho Chi Minh City. The combination of luxurious amenities, exceptional dining options, and outstanding service makes it well worth the price. I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

Room, facility, and service was great, and would recommend to stay here at Hotel Nikko Saigon.

Especially Buffet staffs' service stood out. When I was enjoying Seafood buffet at while staying at the hotel, the roast beef was a bit too raw and tough for me. I cut off parts I did not like, and it was cleared by the server named Nguyen Yen Nhi. She looked closely at my plate and reported something to her manager. Then the manager Tran Van Than(Robert) came up to me and asked what I did not like about the food. He apologized for the food condition then offered me to bring some stake to my taste. Ms. Nguyen and Robert constantly looked after my table and were very attentive. Food was amazing, but the thing touched my heart  was staff's service level.

Thanks to their service I will strongly recommend my friends and family to stay at the Nikko Saigon, and to try the seafood buffet even if they don't stay at different hotel.

Thank you so much for perfecting my stay.

lucas, dang and steven is very professional!
I had a truly delightful experience at the hotel buffet, and a particular staff member made it even more special. Their service was outstanding ‚Äì they were attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure my satisfaction. I was thoroughly impressed with their professionalism and warm demeanor. It's because of excellent staff like this that my visit was so enjoyable. Highly recommend!

We really love the service at Nikko Saigon. We were upgraded to a 2br suite upon arrival since we were a family of 4. They let us check in at 8am in the morning which  was unexpected but so delighted. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They also allowed late check out at 2pm since our flight departs at 7pm. The service was exceptional! We will definitely stay here again.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Delisa - Fresh Salad Bar HCM offers a variety of fresh and delicious salads at reasonable prices. The staff is friendly and helpful, providing detailed explanations of the menu. While the store is small, it's suitable for a quick lunch or dinner. Customers can customize their own salads and choose from options like Caesar salad with tasty sauce or Avocado Shrimp salad with excellent pesto sauce. Additionally, they offer vegan salad options and healthy drinks to complement the meal.
placeMetadata.address: 158/16 ƒê. Nguy·ªÖn C√¥ng Tr·ª©, Ph∆∞·ªùng Nguy·ªÖn Th√°i B√¨nh, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

reviews.reviewText:
I recently visited Delisa Salad Bar, and I must say, I was really impressed! The salads are incredibly fresh and full of flavor. I tried the one with broccoli, apples, raisins, and chicken, and the combination was delicious. The vegetables were crisp, and the fruits added a perfect balance of sweetness.
The portion size was generous. If you‚Äôre looking for a healthy, tasty meal, Delisa is definitely a must-try! Highly recommended for anyone craving fresh and nutritious food in a cozy setting.
Caesar salad was delicious. Price was right. Also had a yogurt based fruit smoothie. Very good too. I'll be back

We ordered delivery from Delisa and it was delicious!

We ordered avocado toast, Greek salad, and Caesar salad. The delivery came in the cutest eco-friendly packaging. The salads were good portion size. The dressing ( we always order extra) was very good.

We posted pictures that show the food.

We will order delivery again soon!

For more adventures follow us on YouTube @eyecool

There are many types of salad that you hardly can find anywhere else. Salad is fresh. The staff are very friendly. The atmosphere is quite small since they seem to sell more on Grab, not dine in. So the place is actually cozy for me. It is in an old alley mixing the old and new Saigonese culture, very interesting.

First time come, and I‚Äôm quite impressed about the service quality here. For me, the servings are quite generous, and beautifully presented.
One thing need to improve, small space and slightly noisy in the rush hour (noon).
However, the friendly staffs will help you immediately when you need or ask something.
Overall, lovely place, will come back and reccomend for my friends.

Salad is so good and fresh with very decent price. I tried many different salad shops and Delisa can balance the quality and price.  The staff are very friendly, they explained quite carefully the menu though I asked a lot (Sorry for too much question). The store is quite small and too simple for chilling but good enough to take a quick lunch or dinner.My favourite is Caesar salad, the sauce is so nice. You can also choose your own ingredients by order Myown salad which I highly appreciate.
I also recommend the Avocado Shrimp salad since their pesto sauce is best in the town. They charge more and give you one full sauce box if you ask for more sauce. So the sauce is not free but it's fair.

I took away the avocado shrimp salad here for 119k. Love the pesto sauce. Salad and shrimp is fresh. The price is reasonable. When I was there, I saw lots of shippers and I am the only guest. I guess they sell more via delivery app and don't invest too much in dine in. So their space is quite small and simple but looks cozy, comfortable & clean enough. Staff is very friendly.

A little hidden from the main road. Need to walk into a narrower alley and can see many more shops around. Interesting setup.

Shop has limited seats.

The salad is definitely tasty with sizeable portion. Drinks are fine.
There's no need to over eat ...

Pricing is reasonable, actually good value for money.

placeMetadata.name: Red Chilli Seafood Buffet

sources.snippet: Red Chili Seafood Seafood Buffet Restaurant is the perfect place to have a romantic dinner under the shimmering light. If your special one loves to enjoy seafood parties in a space shimmering with light like a fairy castle, Red Chili Seafood Buffet Restaurant is the perfect choice for a romantic dinner in Ho Chi Minh city. Using elegant and delicate white tones as the main color, the entire space of the restaurant has a luxurious aftertaste of a magnificent castle.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The renowned seafood restaurant Lobster Bay is located in the heart of Saigon. The Cajun-spiced dishes here are some of the best in town, and the fresh seafood is simply delicious. The atmosphere is casually elegant, and the prices are very reasonable.
placeMetadata.address: 484 ƒê. Nguy·ªÖn Tri Ph∆∞∆°ng, Ph∆∞·ªùng 9, Qu·∫≠n 10, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

reviews.reviewText: Absolutely delicious crab soup. Well worth seeking this place out.
Good food , nice Staff and clean place
Ate here 3 years ago it was wonderful.  Ate here again today and was the worst $75 dollar I have ever spent at a resturant in 45 years.  Overcooked and un-edible.  Do not spend a penny here.

The cajun sauce is similar to the style in Houston, making this one of the best places to eat cajun food.  It is hard to find fresh crawfish anywhere in Saigon so dont expect fresh crawfish.  Overall highly recommended if you are craving cajun seafood.  The sauce alone makes any seafood you choose tasty.
It's a bit expensive...average flavor. Nothing particularly special about the food or the venue that justifies the higher than average prices. I don't really recommend a visit.
Good service, good food though litchi tea, I only tasted the tea, there was no smell or taste of litchi. But all in all it is a good place would go again another time
A bit pricey but very delicious
Good restaurant and service

reviews.reviewText: Great location in the heart of Saigon. Lovely Parisien style design and packed full of delicious pastries and cakes. I also enjoyed the coffee and the comfy surroundings. Nice friendly service also. Well worth checking out

+++ best red velvet. Usually i like my dessert very sweet. This one wasn't sweet but it's been still the best red velvet i had
+++ coconut was very creamy

--- they had to clean the top window

Buttery Cake & Cafe

We have been coming to this pastry shop and cafe for breakfast for several mornings and I like it. If someone like us doesn't book breakfast at the hotel, this allows us to explore the bars, pastry shops or cafes in the area in the morning and not always stay in the hotel, then in Ho Chi Minh walking in the morning is a spectacle, the atmosphere, the people getting ready for their work, in the preparation of food of every quality, flavor and aroma, seeing the human river on scooters heading to work, carrying everything on their scooters üõµ and parents accompanying their children even 5 on the scooter... how wonderful! ü§© . Returning to the place, making a very brief description, the pastries are good and also the various types of coffee both hot and cold.

FOOD AND DRINKS:
The desserts are really good and also aesthetically pleasing, the croissants ü•ê are of different qualities with various fillings and there are different sizes from large to mignon and are served hot, the pastries are also good. The coffee ‚òïÔ∏è of various specialties, Vietnamese, American or Italian both hot and cold is excellent, however my favorite is the Vietnamese coffee. In addition to coffee, the desserts also have various juices and even sandwiches but I have never tried them.

PRICE:
To get an idea of ‚Äã‚Äãhow much it costs, one morning we ordered a hot Vietnamese coffee with milk‚òïÔ∏è, a cold coconut coffee, a large empty croissant ü•ê and two mignon croissants with cream filling and we spent about 3,500,000 dong (about 12 fr)

EXTERIOR ENVIRONMENT:
The Buttery cake and cafe is located in a street in the center, near the famous Nguyen Hue Street in Ho Chi Minh, next to it there are many shops and other cafes, then the usual scooters üõµ parked everywhere on the sidewalk and the guard who controls them. The facade is a glass that you can see the inside and the sign is simple but aesthetically nice.

INTERIOR AMBIENCE:
When you enter you are immediately greeted by the pastry shop window and then there is the counter, it is a long and narrow place on several floors. The predominant colors are white and light brown and the armchairs and sofas are comfortable, even the furniture is tasteful. Then there is a staircase that goes up to the upper floors that lights up when you go up and gives a nice light effect.

ATMOSPHERE:
The atmosphere is relaxing, the light of the lamps is not annoying, with background songs üé∂ also these relaxing, the only thing is that the different times we went they were always the same songs.

SERVICE:
The staff is all young, professional, kind and fast in the service. Well done üëè

TO IMPROVE:
Everything is good, the only advice is to change the background music every now and then, because after a few days you hear the same songs üé∂, which are beautiful, but then become boring.

Pass by this store several times, and finally have time to sit down and have a cup of coffee. Beverage here is decorated good. But the bottle size is a bit too small, flavor was so so, not that impressed me. But the store environment is very pretty to take nice pictures.

Cake and cafe shop near Nguyen Hue walking stress, right in the center of District 1. The shop is beautifully decorated and clean. There are many types of cakes with beautiful eye-catching shapes. However, the cakes are only suitable for taking virtual photos. Because the cakes we ordered all tasted very normal, not that delicious. The price is way too expensive maybe because the shop is located in the center of the city.

I wouldn't get the onigri croissant again. It was quite dense and stale .  All the cream came out the other way after the first bite. To avoid this, I guess it is best to use knife and fork on it.

I thought the chocolate clam was solid. It was beautiful in presentation as well.

The staff here seem friendly and helpful.  The place was bright and clean.

The price point is on the expensive side but not too outrageous for tourists.
A beautiful cafe with the most amazing cakes, not overly sweet and has wonderful taste. Drinks are refreshing and innovative. Would fly back to Vietnam just to eat it again üòç
One of my favorite places for patisserie in town. The Christmas vibes at this cafe right now is so warm and festive with the Christmas holiday cakes.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Are you looking for the best [autocompleteTerm] in [geoNameWithThe]? You‚Äôre not alone! Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. We‚Äôve looked through different sources to find the best options, including favorites like [examplePlaceNames].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
If you're a seafood lover, Ho Chi Minh City is a treasure trove waiting to be explored. From the bustling streets of District 1 to the serene rooftops overlooking the city, this vibrant metropolis offers a plethora of seafood buffet restaurants that cater to every palate. Imagine indulging in fresh oysters, succulent lobsters, and a variety of grilled dishes, all while soaking in the lively atmosphere of this dynamic city. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply treating yourself to a delightful meal, the seafood buffets here promise an unforgettable dining experience.

As you navigate through the culinary landscape of Ho Chi Minh City, you'll discover a mix of well-established favorites and exciting new spots. Picture yourself at La Brasserie Restaurant, where you can savor luxurious seafood delicacies, or at The Log Restaurant, where the ambiance feels like a cozy treehouse retreat. With options ranging from traditional Vietnamese flavors to modern fusion cuisine, there's something for everyone. So, grab your appetite and get ready to dive into the best seafood buffets this city has to offer!
